doc.title: Investment Thesis, Valuation and Risks
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-30/BYD - HA Bottoming out after 2Q25 missBYD - HA Bottoming out after 2Q25 miss_2025-08-30

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted, sold or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.

BYD's 2Q25 earnings came in \(30\%\) shy of expectations as a result of fierce price competition during the quarter that weighed on the GPM. A record- level price discount seen in the entire industry in June has started to narrow after the government's "anti- involution" efforts. Management believes profitability should start to rebound in 3Q25. Longer term, our view on BYD remains unchanged, especially regarding its overseas expansion where capacity- build (i.e. Indonesia, Brazil, and Hungary) is one to two quarters ahead of plan. We thus forecast the overseas business to contribute to around half of BYD's total profit, up from \(\sim 40\%\) this year. We cut our 2025/26 estimates by \(21\% /7\%\) to reflect the results and thus reduce our Jun- 26 share price targets to \(\mathrm{HK}\$ 150 / \mathrm{Rmb}140\) .

- Recap of our thesis: We believe BYD will remain a competitive player in the global NEV market toward 2030 and beyond, thanks to: a) global expansion: We believe BYD's business model will strategically shift from a pure exporter in the past to increasing localization, along with completion and ramp-up of key overseas plants - Thailand (2H24), Indonesia (July 2025), Hungary (3Q25), Turkey and Brazil (1Q26). b) vertical integration and hence cost efficiencies; and c) comprehensive product offerings across price points and different powertrain variations - BEV and PHEV: we expect BYD's new models presumably with fresh design from 4Q25 onward will help boost sales volume into FY26-27.

- 2Q25 result highlights: 1) Revenue grew by \(14\%\) yoy/18% qoq on the back of \(16\%\) yoy/14% qoq volume growth in 2Q25. 2) GPM dropped to \(16.3\%\) in 2Q25 from \(20.1\%\) in 1Q25, mainly due to fierce price competition starting in late May. 3) BYD-E's contribution: earnings at BYD-E were up by \(22\%\) yoy/78% qoq. 4) Opex ratio narrowed from \(12.9\%\) in 1Q25 to \(12.1\%\) in 2Q25 mainly thanks to well-contained SG&A expenses while R&D expenses increased dramatically by \(71\%\) yoy/87% qoq in 2Q25 due to company's continued investment in core technologies. Overall, the company's net earnings were down \(30\%\) yoy/and net profit per unit dropped to Rmb 5.6k. We project quarterly per unit profit will improve into 2H25 thanks to narrowing pricing discounts.
Equity Ratings and Price Targets

We expect 2026 will mark an important strategic inflection point and milestone for BYD's global ambitions, as four of its overseas production bases or assembly lines (in Thailand, Indonesia, Brazil and Hungary) should be completed and ramping up progressively (with Thailand first, starting in 1H25). Despite facing rising tariffs in the EU, we believe BYD will aim to compete outside China on content or product, rather than price. Also, rising opportunities in the PHEV segment in China and potentially globally present further business opportunities. We retain our long- held OW rating.

Our Jun- 26 PT of HK\$150 is based on our blended multiples/DCF methodology. Our analysis suggests BYD- H's long- term share price could range from HK\$134 to HK\$167 subject to market sentiment and risk appetite. Our PT is based on the median of the long- term fair value range.

Long term, our thesis that BYD will become “the Toyota” of the global EV marketplace has not changed. We believe BYD's business model will strategically shift from a pure exporter in the past to increasing localization, along with completion and ramp-up of key overseas plants - Thailand (2H24), Indonesia (July 2025), Hungary (3Q25), Turkey and Brazil (1Q26). Also, rising opportunities in the PHEV segment in China and potentially globally present further business opportunities. We retain our long-held OW rating.
Our Jun-26 PT of HK$150 is based on our blended multiples/DCF methodology.

We expect 2026 will mark an important strategic inflection point and milestone for BYD's global ambitions, as four of its overseas production bases or assembly lines (in Thailand, Indonesia, Brazil and Hungary) should be completed and ramping up progressively (with Thailand first, starting in 1H25). Despite facing rising tariffs in the EU, we believe BYD will aim to compete outside China on content or product, rather than price. Also, rising opportunities in the PHEV segment in China and potentially globally present further business opportunities. We retain our long-held OW rating.

Our Jun- 26 PT of Rmb140 is based on our blended multiples/DCF methodology. Our analysis suggests BYD's long- term share price may range from Rmb122 to Rmb153 subject to market sentiment and risk appetite. Our PT is based on the median of the long- term fair value range.

Long term, our thesis that BYD will likely become "the Toyota" in the global EV market place has not changed. We believe BYD's business model will strategically shift from a pure exporter in the past to increasing localization, along with completion and ramp- up of key overseas plants – Thailand (2H24), Indonesia (July 2025), Hungary (3Q25), Turkey and Brazil (1Q26). Also, rising opportunities in the PHEV segment in China and potentially globally present further business opportunities. We retain our long- held OW rating.
Our June- 26 PT of Rmb140 is based on our blended multiples/DCF methodology.

J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N= Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market

index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
